IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of the College is to prepare students personally, socially and intellectually to effectively function in a changing global society.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To motivate and direct its students to seek holistic development that leads to intellectual, ethical, spiritual, and service-oriented lives.
IRS990.Desc: To sustain a learning community in which students can prepare academically, socially, and spiritually for leadership in a complex, diverse and rapidly changing world.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Auxiliary enterprises support the Colleges mission of providing quality educational opportunities. These services include, but are not limited to food service, campus housing, campus post office, vending, campus stores and athletics.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: CFO/Senior Vice President of Finance and Administration

ProgramServiceRevenueGrp.Desc: Sales and Services of Auxiliary Enterprises

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: Financial derivatives and other financial products

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The campus of Miles College is home to various collections of art. The displays are used for public exhibition, but more importantly for the education of future generations seeking knowledge of the past.
The endowment funds shown are permanently restricted. The College does not intend to use the funds.

The Collegs policy is to record a liability for any tax position taken that is beneficial to the College, including any related interest and penalties, when it is more-likely-than-not the position taken by management with respect to a transactions will be overturned by a taxing authority upon examination. Management believes there is no such position as of June 30, 2022, and accordingly, no liability has been accrued.

The College offers scholarships and student financial aid to assist with meeting the students financial obligations . The Financial Aid Office has the necessary policies and procedures to ensure that the Colllege adheres to and complies with federal regulations regarding eligibility for student financial aid. Requirements to receiving scholarships depend on other factors, such as grade point average, family income, or athletic talents.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Collegs financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: CFO/Senior Vice President of Finance and Administration

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: The Private Colleges and Universities Facilities Authority
The Private Colleges and Universities Facilities Authority
The Private Colleges and Universities Facilities Authority

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The College presents the Form 990 to its finance/audit commttee for review when the form is ready. Depending on when the committee meets and the due date of the return, the Form 990 is either modified before it is filed or an amendment is filed for any changes required from the finance/audit committees review.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Trustees are required to disclose at the next convening Board of Trustees meeting any conflict of interest. Trustees with a conflict of interest on a matter of vote must abstain from voting. The Colleges audit/finance committee is responsible for ensuring adherence to the policy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Trustees, based on predetermined areas of performance, evaluates the work of the President annually. The Boards Evaluation and Compensation Committee evaluates the performance. When additional compensation is deemed appropriate, a review of salaries at peer institutions is conducted to assist in arriving at a recommendation to the Executive Committee for approval.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation for top officers of the College is at the discretion of the President. This discrection is based on 1 previous salary, 2 market data from CUPA survey published in the Chronicle of Higher Education, and 3 the bargaining process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The College makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public upon request. To obtain copies, contact the business office and submit a request identifying the specific documents.
